014package org.jdbi.v3.postgres;
015
016import java.sql.Connection;
017import java.util.Map;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.Jdbi;
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.ArgumentFactory;
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.JdbiClassUtils;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.exceptions.Unchecked;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.spi.JdbiPlugin;
026import org.jdbi.v3.postgres.internal.BitStringEnumSetArgumentFactory;
027import org.jdbi.v3.postgres.internal.BitStringEnumSetMapperFactory;
028import org.postgresql.PGConnection;
029import org.postgresql.geometric.PGbox;
030import org.postgresql.geometric.PGcircle;
031import org.postgresql.geometric.PGline;
032import org.postgresql.geometric.PGlseg;
033import org.postgresql.geometric.PGpath;
034import org.postgresql.geometric.PGpoint;
035import org.postgresql.geometric.PGpolygon;
036import org.postgresql.util.PGInterval;
037import org.postgresql.util.PGmoney;
038
039/**
040 * Postgres plugin. Adds support for binding and mapping the following data types:
041 *
042 * <ul>
043 * <li>{@link java.net.InetAddress} (including {@link java.net.Inet4Address} and {@link java.net.Inet6Address})</li>
044 * <li>{@link java.time.LocalDate}</li>
045 * <li>{@link java.time.LocalTime}</li>
046 * <li>{@link java.time.LocalDateTime}</li>
047 * <li>{@link java.time.OffsetDateTime}</li>
048 * <li>{@link java.time.Duration} (see notes below)</li>
049 * <li>{@link java.time.Period} (see notes below)</li>
050 * <li>{@link java.util.Map Map&lt;String, String&gt;} (for {@code HSTORE} columns)</li>
051 * <li>{@link java.util.UUID}</li>
052 * <li>{@link java.io.InputStream} and {@link java.io.Reader} from {@code oid} large object columns</li>
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <p>
056 * The following qualified types have {@link org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta} support for binding and mapping:
057 *
058 * <ul>
059 * <li>{@link MacAddr @MacAddr java.lang.String} (for MACADDR columns)</li>
060 * <li>{@link HStore @HStore Map&lt;String, String&gt;} (for HSTORE columns)</li>
061 * </ul>
062 *
063 * <p>
064 * Also sets up SQL array support for the following types:
065 *
066 * <ul>
067 * <li>{@code double}</li>
068 * <li>{@code float}</li>
069 * <li>{@code int}</li>
070 * <li>{@code long}</li>
071 * <li>{@link java.lang.Double}</li>
072 * <li>{@link java.lang.Float}</li>
073 * <li>{@link java.lang.Integer}</li>
074 * <li>{@link java.lang.Long}</li>
075 * <li>{@link java.lang.String}</li>
076 * <li>{@link java.util.UUID}</li>
077 * </ul>
078 *
079 * <p>
080 * A note about the mapping between the Postgres {@code interval} type and the Java {@link java.time.Period} and
081 * {@link java.time.Duration} types:
082 * The Java library authors are much more strict about the temporal amounts representable by Periods and Durations than
083 * Postgres is with its {@code interval} type.  The argument factories and column mapper factories implemented in this
084 * package respect this spirit of unambiguous strictness.  Consequently:
085 * <ul>
086 *     <li>All {@link java.time.Period}s can be mapped to {@code interval}s.</li>
087 *     <li>Not all {@link java.time.Duration}s can be mapped to {@code interval}s.</li>
088 *     <li>Not all {@code interval}s can be mapped to {@link java.time.Period}s.</li>
089 *     <li>Not all {@code interval}s can be mapped to {@link java.time.Duration}s.</li>
090 * </ul>
091 * For more specific detail, see the caveats in the documentation for {@link DurationArgumentFactory},
092 * {@link PeriodColumnMapperFactory}, and {@link DurationColumnMapperFactory}.
093 *
094 * <p>
095 * In addition, some potentially unexpected implicit conversions can occur by virtue of the Postgres <em>server</em>
096 * logic. For example, at the time of writing, storing a Period of -3 years, 2 months, and -1 days results in an
097 * interval (and consequently, a column-mapped Period) of <em>-2 years, -10 months</em>, and -1 days.
098 */
099public class PostgresPlugin extends JdbiPlugin.Singleton {
100
101    private final boolean installLegacy;
102
103    /**
104     * Do not install the legacy (unqualified) bindings for {@link HStoreArgumentFactory} and {@link HStoreColumnMapper}. When
105     * using the plugin returned by this factory method, any lookup for HStore specific arguments and column mappers must be qualified
106     * with the {@link HStore} annotation.
107     */
108    public static PostgresPlugin noUnqualifiedHstoreBindings() {
109        return new PostgresPlugin(false);
110    }
111
112    public PostgresPlugin() {
113        this(true);
114    }
115
116    protected PostgresPlugin(boolean installLegacy) {
117        this.installLegacy = installLegacy;
118    }
119
120    @Override
121    public void customizeJdbi(Jdbi jdbi) {
122        jdbi.registerArgument(new TypedEnumArgumentFactory());
123        jdbi.registerArgument(new JavaTimeArgumentFactory());
124        jdbi.registerArgument(new DurationArgumentFactory());
125        jdbi.registerArgument(new PeriodArgumentFactory());
126        jdbi.registerArgument(new InetArgumentFactory());
127        jdbi.registerArgument(new HStoreArgumentFactory());
128        jdbi.registerArgument(new MacAddrArgumentFactory());
129        jdbi.registerArgument(new UUIDArgumentFactory());
130        jdbi.registerArgument(new PGobjectArgumentFactory());
131        jdbi.registerArgument(new BitStringEnumSetArgumentFactory());
132        jdbi.registerArgument(new BlobInputStreamArgumentFactory());
133        jdbi.registerArgument(new ClobReaderArgumentFactory());
134
135        // built-in PGobject types
136        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGbox.class, "box");
137        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGcircle.class, "circle");
138        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGInterval.class, "interval");
139        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGline.class, "line");
140        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGlseg.class, "lseg");
141        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGmoney.class, "money");
142        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGpath.class, "path");
143        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGpoint.class, "point");
144        jdbi.registerArrayType(PGpolygon.class, "polygon");
145
146        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new JavaTimeMapperFactory());
147        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new HStoreColumnMapper());
148        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new MacAddrColumnMapper());
149        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new DurationColumnMapperFactory());
150        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new PeriodColumnMapperFactory());
151        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new PGobjectColumnMapperFactory());
152        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new BitStringEnumSetMapperFactory());
153        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new BlobInputStreamColumnMapperFactory());
154        jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new ClobReaderColumnMapperFactory());
155
156        if (installLegacy) {
157            // legacy unqualified HSTORE
158            jdbi.registerArgument((ArgumentFactory) new HStoreArgumentFactory()::build);
159            jdbi.registerColumnMapper(new GenericType<Map<String, String>>() {}, new HStoreColumnMapper());
160        }
161
162        // optional integration
163        if (JdbiClassUtils.isPresent("org.jdbi.v3.json.JsonConfig")) {
164            jdbi.registerArgument(new JsonArgumentFactory());
165        }
166    }
167
168    @Override
169    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CloseResource")
170    public Handle customizeHandle(Handle handle) {
171        Connection conn = handle.getConnection();
172        PGConnection pgConnection = Unchecked.supplier(() -> conn.unwrap(PGConnection.class)).get();
173        return handle.configure(PostgresTypes.class, pt -> {
174            pt.addTypesToConnection(pgConnection);
175            pt.setLobApi(new PgLobApiImpl(conn));
176        });
177    }
178}
